  <xs:simpleType name="IncidentOverallImpactSeverityCodeSimpleType">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data type for the level of severity of the impact of an incident against the business as a whole.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:restriction base="xs:token">
      <xs:enumeration value="Baseline">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>A baseline priority incident is highly unlikely to affect public health or safety, national security, economic security, foreign relations, civil liberties, or public confidence.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="High (Orange)">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>A High priority incident is likely to result in a demonstrable impact to public health or safety, national security, economic security, foreign relations, civil liberties, or public confidence.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Low (Green)">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>A Low priority incident is unlikely to affect public health or safety, national security, economic security, foreign relations, civil liberties, or public confidence.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Medium (Yellow)">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>A Medium priority incident may affect public health or safety, national security, economic security, foreign relations, civil liberties, or public confidence.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Severe (Red)">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>A Severe priority incident is likely to result in a significant impact to public health or safety, national security, economic security, foreign relations, or civil liberties.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
    </xs:restriction>
  </xs:simpleType>
  <xs:complexType name="IncidentOverallImpactSeverityCodeType">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data type for the level of severity of the impact of an incident against the business as a whole.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:simpleContent>
      <xs:extension base="cyber:IncidentOverallImpactSeverityCodeSimpleType">
        <xs:attributeGroup ref="structures:SimpleObjectAttributeGroup"/>
      </xs:extension>
    </xs:simpleContent>
  </xs:complexType>
  <xs:simpleType name="IncidentRecoverabilityAssessmentCodeSimpleType">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data type for an estimate of the scope of resources needed to recover from an incident</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:restriction base="xs:token">
      <xs:enumeration value="Extended">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>Time to recovery is unpredictable; additional resources and outside help are needed</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Not Recoverable">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>Recovery from the incident is not possible (i.e., sensitive data exfiltrated and posted publicly)</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Regular">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>Time to recovery is predictable with existing resources</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Supplemented">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>Time to recovery is predictable with additional resources</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
    </xs:restriction>
  </xs:simpleType>
  <xs:complexType name="IncidentRecoverabilityAssessmentCodeType">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data type for an estimate of the scope of resources needed to recover from an incident</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:simpleContent>
      <xs:extension base="cyber:IncidentRecoverabilityAssessmentCodeSimpleType">
        <xs:attributeGroup ref="structures:SimpleObjectAttributeGroup"/>
      </xs:extension>
    </xs:simpleContent>
  </xs:complexType>
  <xs:simpleType name="IncidentResponseForensicsCategoryCodeSimpleType">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data type for the category describing the forensics response.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:restriction base="xs:token">
      <xs:enumeration value="complete">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>Forensics is fully complete.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="complete pending report">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>Forensics is complete pending the final report.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="not required">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>Forensics is not required.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="not started">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>Forensics is not started.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="ongoing">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>Forensics is ongoing.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
    </xs:restriction>
  </xs:simpleType>
  <xs:complexType name="IncidentResponseForensicsCategoryCodeType">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data type for the category describing the forensics response.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:simpleContent>
      <xs:extension base="cyber:IncidentResponseForensicsCategoryCodeSimpleType">
        <xs:attributeGroup ref="structures:SimpleObjectAttributeGroup"/>
      </xs:extension>
    </xs:simpleContent>
  </xs:complexType>
  <xs:simpleType name="IncidentResponseLessonLearnedCategoryCodeSimpleType">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data type for a kind of lesson learned for responding to a future incident</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:restriction base="xs:token">
      <xs:enumeration value="Lesson Learned Defense">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>An improvement that can be made to lower the mean time to defense</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Lesson Learned Defensive Measures">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>A defensive measure that can be implemented to prevent similar incidents</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Lesson Learned Discovery Method">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>An improvement that can be made to lower the mean time to detection</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Lesson Learned Effective Analysis Improvement">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>An improvement that can be made to lower the mean time to effective analysis</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Lesson Learned Future Watch Indicator">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>A precursor or indicator that should be watched for in the future to detect similar incidents</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Lesson Learned Information Handling">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>An improvement that can be made to the incident handling process</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Lesson Learned Information Needs">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>Information that could help with an incident, if provided in a timely manner</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Lesson Learned Information Sharing">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>An improvement that can be made to the information sharing process</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Lesson Learned Information Source">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>A source of information that could help with an incident</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Lesson Learned Reporting">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>An improvement that can be made to lower the mean time to reporting</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Lesson Learned Resource Need">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>An additional tool or resource that are needed to detect, analyze, and mitigate future incidents</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Lesson Learned Response">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>An improvement that can be made to lower the mean time to response</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
    </xs:restriction>
  </xs:simpleType>
  <xs:complexType name="IncidentResponseLessonLearnedCategoryCodeType">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data type for a kind of lesson learned for responding to a future incident</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:simpleContent>
      <xs:extension base="cyber:IncidentResponseLessonLearnedCategoryCodeSimpleType">

  </xs:complexType>

        </xs:sequence>
      </xs:extension>
    </xs:complexContent>
  </xs:complexType>
  <xs:simpleType name="IncidentServicesImpactSeverityCodeSimpleType">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data type for the level of severity of the impact to internally-facing services by an incident.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:restriction base="xs:token">
      <xs:enumeration value="Critical">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>A critical incident with very high impact, for example an incident that takes all or almost all external facing services offline for an extended period of time.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Major">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>A major incident with significant impact, for example an incident that disables external facing services for a short period of time.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Minor">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>A minor incident with limited impact, for example an incident that temporarily degrades external facing services.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
    </xs:restriction>
  </xs:simpleType>
  <xs:complexType name="IncidentServicesImpactSeverityCodeType">

  <xs:simpleType name="IncidentSystemJeopardyCodeSimpleType">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data type for an indication of whether an incident actually or imminently jeopardizes the integrity, confidentiality, or availability of information or an information system</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:restriction base="xs:token">
      <xs:enumeration value="Actual Jeopardy">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>An occurrence that actually jeopardizes, without lawful authority, the integrity, confidentiality, or availability of information or an information system</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Imminent Jeopardy">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>An occurrence that imminently jeopardizes, without lawful authority, the integrity, confidentiality, or availability of information or an information system</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
    </xs:restriction>
  </xs:simpleType>

  <xs:simpleType name="NotifyingAgencyCategoryCodeSimpleType">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data type for a category code for an agency who provided the original notification of a potential incident.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:restriction base="xs:token">
      <xs:enumeration value="CISA">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Company not under contract">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>A company that has no contractual affiliation</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Customer">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>A customer, client, or citizen</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="FBI">

        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>

        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Law enforcement agency">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>State, local, or tribal law enforcement agency</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Other">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>Another entity</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Other federal agency">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>Another U.S. federal agency other than the FBI or CISA</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Supply chain vendor">

          <xs:documentation>A supply chain vendor</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>

        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
    </xs:restriction>

        <xs:sequence>
          <xs:element ref="cyber:OrganizationCategoryCode" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/>
          <xs:element ref="cyber:ReportingOrganizationIdentification" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/>
          <xs:element ref="nc:Facility" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/>
        </xs:sequence>
      </xs:extension>
    </xs:complexContent>
  </xs:complexType>
  <xs:simpleType name="OrganizationCategoryCodeSimpleType">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data type for a kind of organization</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:restriction base="xs:token">
      <xs:enumeration value="Foreign Government">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>The organization is an entity of a foreign government</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Individual">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>The organization is an individually run entity</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Private Sector">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>The organization is a private sector entity</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="United States - State, Local, Tribal, or Territorial Government">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>The organization is a United States State, Local, Tribal, or Territorial Government entity</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="United States Federal Government">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>The organization is an entity of the United States Federal Government</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
    </xs:restriction>
  </xs:simpleType>

  <xs:simpleType name="SecurityIncidentActualityCodeSimpleType">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data type for the indication of the actual status of the security incident, based on VERIS codes.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:restriction base="xs:token">
      <xs:enumeration value="Confirmed">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>VERIS Incident Description Enumeration for Security Incident confirming that the incident was a real incident.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="False Positive">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>VERIS Incident Description Enumeration for Security Incident indicating that the incident was a false positive in which a response was triggered but no incident occurred.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Near Miss">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>VERIS Incident Description Enumeration for Security Incident indicating that the actions did not compromise the asset.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Suspected">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>VERIS Incident Description Enumeration for Security Incident indicating that the incident is suspected but not confirmed to be a real incident.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
    </xs:restriction>
  </xs:simpleType>

  <xs:simpleType name="TrafficLightProtocolCodeSimpleType">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data type for a statement of the permitted redistribution of received information</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:restriction base="xs:token">
      <xs:enumeration value="Amber">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>Limited disclosure of information, restricted to participants’ organizations, and with clients or customers who need to know the information to protect themselves from further harm</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Green">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>Limited disclosure of information, restricted to peers and partners in the community</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Red">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>Information not for disclosure, restricted to participants only</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="White">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>Disclosure of information is not limited</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
    </xs:restriction>
  </xs:simpleType>

  <xs:simpleType name="VulnerabilityExploitationAvailabilityCodeSimpleType">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data type for a category code of a vulnerability's ability to be exploited.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:restriction base="xs:token">
      <xs:enumeration value="Exploit incorporated into one or more tools">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>The exploit has been incorporated into one or more tool sets, such as an exploit kit.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Exploit not yet available">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>The exploit is not yet available on the Internet.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Exploited in the wild">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>The exploit is widely available on the Internet.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Other">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>A different option applies.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Proof-of-concept (POC) demonstrated">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>A demonstration that the exploit works.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Proof-of-concept (POC) published">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>A code or other example that the exploit works.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
    </xs:restriction>
  </xs:simpleType>
  <xs:complexType name="VulnerabilityExploitationAvailabilityCodeType">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data type for a category code of a vulnerability's ability to be exploited.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:simpleContent>
      <xs:extension base="cyber:VulnerabilityExploitationAvailabilityCodeSimpleType">

  </xs:complexType>

    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:complexContent>
      <xs:extension base="structures:ObjectType">
        <xs:sequence>
          <xs:element ref="cyber:VulnerabilityExploitationAvailabilityCode" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/>

        </xs:sequence>
      </xs:extension>
    </xs:complexContent>
  </xs:complexType>
  <xs:simpleType name="VulnerabilityWidespreadCodeSimpleType">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data type for information about how many entities are impacted by a vulnerability.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:restriction base="xs:token">
      <xs:enumeration value="Internet-wide">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>The vulnerability impacts a majority of Internet users.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Limited subset of users">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>The vulnerability impacts a subset of users, defined by a special status, platform, system, or software.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="National">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>The vulnerability impact affects all of a country.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Other">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>The vulnerability impacts a different group or geographic range.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Regional">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>The vulnerability impact is limited to a region of a country.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Sector-wide">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>The vulnerability impacts a specific sector.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
      <xs:enumeration value="Single entity">
        <xs:annotation>
          <xs:documentation>The vulnerability impacts a single company, organization, association, or government agency.</xs:documentation>
        </xs:annotation>
      </xs:enumeration>
    </xs:restriction>
  </xs:simpleType>
  <xs:complexType name="VulnerabilityWidespreadCodeType">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data type for information about how many entities are impacted by a vulnerability.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
    <xs:simpleContent>
      <xs:extension base="cyber:VulnerabilityWidespreadCodeSimpleType">
        <xs:attributeGroup ref="structures:SimpleObjectAttributeGroup"/>
      </xs:extension>
    </xs:simpleContent>
  </xs:complexType>
  <xs:element name="AccessedInformationCode" type="cyber:AccessedInformationCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A kind of information that has been or potentially has been accessed, manipulated, destroyed, or rendered unusable as a result of a breach</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="AccidentIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if the incident was the result of an accident or from natural causes; false if the incident was malicious in origin.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="AdversaryCommunication" type="cyber:AdversaryCommunicationType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A detail about a communication from an adversary.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="AdversaryCommunicationAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:AdversaryCommunicationType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="AttackPattern" type="cyber:AttackPatternType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A behavior that attackers use to carry out their attacks. It is considered a type of tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs).</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="AttackPatternAliasText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An alternative name used to identify this attack pattern.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="AttackPatternAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:AttackPatternType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="AttackPatternDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of an attack pattern</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="AttackPatternName" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A name of an attack pattern</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="AttackVector" type="cyber:AttackVectorType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A general approach to achieving an effect, which takes advantage of the exposure of a kind of, or a region in, an attack surface</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="AttackVectorAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:AttackVectorType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="AttackVectorCategoryCode" type="cyber:AttackVectorCategoryCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A kind of general approach to achieving an effect, which takes advantage of the exposure of a kind of, or a region in, an attack surface</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="AttackVectorOtherDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of the other kind of attack vector</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BackupAvailableCategoryCode" type="cyber:BackupAvailableCategoryCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A category code for the type of back-up available.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BackupAvailableCategoryCodeOtherDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of another type of backup that is available.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BackupAvailableCompleteIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if a complete backup for an impacted data set exists; false otherwise.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BackupAvailableIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if a backup (complete or incomplete) is available for an impacted data set; false otherwise.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BackupCourseOfAction" type="cyber:BackupCourseOfActionType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A series of details regarding backups.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BackupCourseOfActionAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:BackupCourseOfActionType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BackupFromDate" type="nc:DateType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A date indicating when the most current backup is from.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="Breach" type="cyber:BreachType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A loss of control, compromise, unauthorized access, unauthorized disclosure, unauthorized acquisition of a system, system component(s), data, or process(es)</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachAccessedQuantity" type="nc:QuantityType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A count of information that has been accessed or potentially accessed by a non-authorized user</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachAccessedQuantityCategoryCode" type="cyber:BreachAccessedQuantityCategoryCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A statement of whether information has been accessed or potentially accessed by a non-authorized user</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachAlteredQuantity" type="nc:QuantityType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A count of Information that has been manipulated, destroyed, or rendered unusable</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachAlteredQuantityCategoryCode" type="cyber:BreachAlteredQuantityCategoryCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A statement of whether the count of Information accessed by a non-authorized user is an approximate or known one</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:BreachType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachClassificationCategoryCode" type="cyber:BreachClassificationCategoryCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A kind of category of information that has been or potentially has been accessed, manipulated, destroyed, or rendered unusable as a result of a breach</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachEffect" type="cyber:BreachEffectType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An effect on information resulting from a breach</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachEffectAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:BreachEffectType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachEffectCode" type="cyber:BreachEffectCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A kind of effect on information resulting from a breach</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachExposedFile" type="cyber:BreachExposedFileType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An information about a file exposed in a breach</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachExposedFileAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:BreachExposedFileType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachExposedFileQuantity" type="nc:QuantityType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A count of the files exposed in a breach</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachExposedHealthInformationOver500Indicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if the breach resulted in the exposure of more than 500 protected health records; false otherwise.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachIndividualsNotifiedIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if impacted individuals were notified of a breach; false otherwise</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachNotification" type="cyber:BreachNotificationType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A notification of a breach</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachNotificationAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:BreachNotificationType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachNotificationContactEntity" type="nc:EntityType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A call center or other location where individuals impacted can contact for further information.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachNotificationExplanationText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An explanation text provided to the impacted individuals and/or entities.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachNotificationMethod" type="cyber:BreachNotificationMethodType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A method by which an entity was notified of a breach</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachNotificationMethodAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:BreachNotificationMethodType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachNotificationMethodCode" type="cyber:BreachNotificationMethodCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A method by which individuals were notified of a breach</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachNotificationMonitoringService" type="cyber:BreachNotificationMonitoringServiceType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A service that provides long-term aid, such as credit monitoring or identity theft protection.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachNotificationMonitoringServiceAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:BreachNotificationMonitoringServiceType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachNotificationMonitoringServiceDuration" type="niem-xs:duration" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A duration of time for which the monitoring service is engaged.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachNotificationMonitoringServiceEntity" type="nc:EntityType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An entity that provides a service that provides long-term aid, such as credit monitoring or identity theft protection.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachNotificationMonitoringServiceIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if a service that provides long-term aid, such as credit monitoring or identity theft protection, has been engaged; False otherwise.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachNotificationOtherMethodName" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A name of the other method by which an individual is notified of a breach</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachNotificationQuantity" type="nc:QuantityType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A count of the individuals notified of a breach</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachNotificationRecommendationsText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A series of recommendations provided to the impacted individuals and/or entities.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachNotificationSentDate" type="nc:DateType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A date notifications were sent to the impacted individuals and/or entities.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachObservedData" type="cyber:BreachObservedDataType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A data related to information that has been observed on a cybersecurity related entity</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachObservedDataAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:BreachObservedDataType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachRegulationCategoryCode" type="cyber:BreachRegulationCategoryCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A kind of information protected by law, regulation, or other restriction that was accessed or potentially accessed in a breach.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachRemediationService" type="cyber:BreachRemediationServiceType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A category of breach remediation service provided to an entity</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachRemediationServiceAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:BreachRemediationServiceType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachRemediationServiceCategoryCode" type="cyber:BreachRemediationServiceCategoryCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A kind of breach remediation service provided</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="BreachRemediationServiceQuantity" type="nc:QuantityType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A count of the individuals who were provided breach remediation service</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ClassifiedContactEmailID" type="niem-xs:string" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An electronic mailing address that has been secured for classified communications by which a person or organization may be contacted</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ClassifiedContactTelephoneNumber" type="nc:TelephoneNumberType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A telephone number for a telecommunication device that has been secured for classified communications by which a person or organization may be contacted</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ClassifiedInformationExposure" type="cyber:ClassifiedInformationExposureType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of information related to exposure of classified data</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ClassifiedInformationExposureAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:ClassifiedInformationExposureType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ClassifiedInformationExposureCauseDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of the root cause of the exposure of classified information</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ClassifiedInformationExposureSystemName" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A name of the system on which the exposure of classified information occurred</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ClassifiedInformationOriginationSystemName" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A name of the system from which exposed classified information originated</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CommonVulnerabilityEnumeration" type="cyber:CommonVulnerabilityEnumerationType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An enumeration for a common vulnerability</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CommonVulnerabilityEnumerationAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:CommonVulnerabilityEnumerationType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CommonVulnerabilityEnumerationDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of the Common Vulnerability Enumeration</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CommonVulnerabilityEnumerationID" type="niem-xs:string" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An identifier for a unique Common Vulnerability Enumeration</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CommonVulnerabilityScoringSystemScoreNumeric" type="nc:NumericType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A calculated severity score for a cyber vulnerability assigned by the Common Vulnerability Scoring System</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ComplianceDriverReportedDate" type="nc:DateType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A date when the entity received the report</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ComplianceDriverReportedToEntityDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of which entity receives reports of this type</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ComplianceDriverViolatedText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of the violated compliance driver</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CompromisedByTTP" type="cyber:CyberTTPType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of the behaviors and resources that attackers use to carry out their attacks.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CompromisedByVulnerability" type="cyber:CyberVulnerabilityType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of a vulnerability the adversary used against a specific device.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CompromisedCommunication" type="cyber:CompromisedCommunicationType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An information about compromised communication between systems</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CompromisedCommunicationAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:CompromisedCommunicationType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CompromisedDevice" type="cyber:CompromisedDeviceType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A device compromised by a cyber incident</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CompromisedDeviceAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:CompromisedDeviceType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CompromisedDeviceConnectionIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if an incident handler can connect to a compromised device; false otherwise</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CompromisedDeviceInitialIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if this is first known device that was affected by the cyber incident; false otherwise.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CompromisedOnNetwork" type="cyber:CyberNetworkType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of the network the device was located on at the time of the incident.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CongressionalReport" type="cyber:CongressionalReportType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A report of the cyber incident that was sent to Congress</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CongressionalReportAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:CongressionalReportType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ContactInformationAugmentation" type="cyber:ContactInformationAugmentationType" substitutionGroup="nc:ContactInformationAugmentationPoint" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>Additional information about contact information</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ContactInformationReportingConsentIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if the impacted user has given their consent for their contact information to be reported; false otherwise</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CourseOfAction" type="cyber:CourseOfActionType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An action taken to prevent or respond to an incident</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CourseOfActionAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:CourseOfActionType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CourseOfActionDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of an action taken to prevent or respond to an incident</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CourseOfActionName" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A name of an action taken to prevent or respond to an incident</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CourseOfActionSuccessIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if the Course of Action was successful in stopping or mitigating the threat activity; false otherwise.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberAnalytic" type="cyber:CyberAnalyticType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An information gathered on a cyber incident using analytics</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberAnalyticAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:CyberAnalyticType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberAnalyticDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of what information is gathered through an analytic, as well as what the information indicates</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberAnalyticProgrammingStatement" type="cyber:CyberAnalyticProgrammingStatementType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A programming statement that implements an analytic</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberAnalyticProgrammingStatementAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:CyberAnalyticProgrammingStatementType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberAnalyticProgrammingStatementText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A programming code statement that implements an analytic</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberEnterpriseSubTechniqueCode" type="cyber:CyberEnterpriseSubTechniqueCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A kind of specific representation for an enterprise sub-technique that describes 'how' an adversary achieves a tactical goal by performing an action.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberEnterpriseSubTechniqueOtherDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of another enterprise sub-technique.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberEnterpriseTechniqueCode" type="cyber:CyberEnterpriseTechniqueCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An enterprise technique that describes 'how' an adversary achieves a tactical goal by performing an action.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberEnterpriseTechniqueOtherDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of another enterprise technique.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberIncident" type="cyber:CyberIncidentType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A cyber event that may require a response</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberIncidentAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:CyberIncidentType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberIncidentReportedCongressionalCommitteeDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of the Congressional committee to which the cyber incident was reported</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberIncidentReportedToCongressDateTime" type="nc:DateType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A date and time of the reporting of a cyber incident to Congress</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberIndicatorPattern" type="cyber:CyberIndicatorPatternType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A pattern that can be used to detect suspicious or malicious cyber activity; false otherwise</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberIndicatorPatternAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:CyberIndicatorPatternType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberIndicatorPatternDefensiveMeasureCode" type="cyber:CyberIndicatorPatternDefensiveMeasureCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A designation of the availability of an action to counteract the indicator of compromise.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberIndicatorPatternDefensiveMeasureComplianceIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if the cyber threat indicator or defensive measure submitted by a non-federal entity to the U.S. Federal Government is to be considered commercial, financial, and proprietary information in compliance with the Cybersecurity Information Sharing Act of 2015; false otherwise</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberIndicatorPatternDefensiveMeasureText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An action taken to counteract the indicator of compromise</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberIndicatorPatternDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description that provides more details and context about an Indicator, potentially including its purpose and its key characteristics</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberIndicatorPatternDiamondModelClassificationCode" type="cyber:CyberIndicatorPatternDiamondModelClassificationCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A classification of a cyber indicator by kind of Diamond Model component</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberIndicatorPatternName" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A name of a pattern that can be used to detect suspicious or malicious cyber activity</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="CyberInsuranceClaim" type="cyber:CyberInsuranceClaimType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A cyber insurance claim</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>

    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A percent of the extorted data recovered through the decryption key.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ExtortedDataDecryptionKeyText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A decryption key provided to unencrypt files in an extortion incident.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>

    <xs:annotation>

    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An amount actually paid in response to an extortion demand.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ExtortionPaidDate" type="nc:DateType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A date the extortion was paid.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ExtortionPaidIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if the extortion demand was paid; false otherwise.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ExtortionPaidToDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of who received the extortion funds, including cryptocurrency wallet addresses.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ExtortionTermText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A term for completing the extortion demand, such a demand for a specific payment type.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="FileCategoryName" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A name of a kind of file</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="FirstObservedDate" type="nc:DateType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A beginning date of the time window during which the data related to the incident was seen</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="FISMAIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if a Federal Information Security Management Act of 2002 system; false otherwise</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="Hardware" type="cyber:PlatformType" substitutionGroup="cyber:Platform" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A physical component of a computing device</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="HighValueAssetIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if an incident affected a high value asset; false otherwise</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="IncidentAnalysisResultsShareIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if the results of a cyber incident analysis can be shared; false otherwise</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="IncidentAssistance" type="cyber:IncidentAssistanceType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An assistance required with an incident</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="IncidentAssistanceAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:IncidentAssistanceType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>

      <xs:documentation>A kind of assistance required to respond to an incident</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>

      <xs:documentation>A mandatory information reporting to an entity after an incident</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>

  <xs:element name="IncidentConsequence" type="cyber:IncidentConsequenceType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A series of details about the consequences of an incident.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>

    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A kind of consequence resulting from an incident</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="IncidentConsequenceContractsBreachIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if the incident consequences include the breach of a legal contract; false otherwise.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
