    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="InsuranceResponseShareIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if cyber insurance allows cyber incident information to be shared; false otherwise</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="InsuranceResponseSharingDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of cyber insurance company requirements for sharing information beyond the victim</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="InvolvedEntity" type="nc:EntityType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An external entity that is involved in a cyber incident, other than as a responding entity or victim.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="InvolvedEntityDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of an external entity's involvement in a cyber incident, other than as a responding entity or victim.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="InvolvedEntityName" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A name of an external entity that is involved in a cyber incident, other than as a responding entity or victim.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="KillChainName" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A name of a kill chain</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="KillChainPhase" type="cyber:KillChainPhaseType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A phase in a kill chain, which describes the various phases an attacker may undertake in order to achieve their objectives</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="KillChainPhaseAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:KillChainPhaseType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="KillChainPhaseName" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A name of a phase in a kill chain</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="LastObservedDate" type="nc:DateType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An end date of the time window during which the data related to the incident was seen</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="LessonLearnedCategoryCode" type="cyber:IncidentResponseLessonLearnedCategoryCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A kind of lesson learned for responding to a future incident</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="LessonLearnedDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of a lesson learned</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="MajorIncident" type="cyber:MajorIncidentType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A designation of whether an incident is classified as a major incident</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="MajorIncidentAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:MajorIncidentType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="MajorIncidentDesignationReasonText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of the reason for categorizing the incident as a major incident</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="Malware" type="cyber:MalwareType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A software or firmware intended to perform an unauthorized process that will have adverse impact on the confidentiality, integrity, or availability of an information system</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="MalwareAliasName" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An additional name of a malware instance or family</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="MalwareAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:MalwareType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="MalwareDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of a malware instance or family</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="MalwareHashAlgorithmText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An algorithm used to produce a hash.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="MalwareHashText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A hash value or code; a result of a function to map data of an arbitrary size to a fixed-size.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="MalwareName" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A name of a malware instance or family</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="MediaNotificationRequiredIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if the media must be notified of the incident; false otherwise.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="MediaNotifiedDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An explanation of which media outlets were notified.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="MediaNotifiedIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if the media was notified of the incident; false otherwise.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="NetworkMapAvailableIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if a network map is available for the network; false otherwise</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="NotificationPromptedReasonDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An explanation of how the notifying agency received their information.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="NotificationReasonDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An explanation of why the notifying agency contacted the potential victim.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="NotifyingAgencyCategoryCode" type="cyber:NotifyingAgencyCategoryCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A category code for an agency who provided the original notification of a potential incident.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="NotifyingAgencyCategoryCodeDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of another entity category.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ObservationPublicInternetIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if the breach's Personally Identifiable Information data was observed on the public Internet; false otherwise</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ObservedData" type="cyber:ObservedDataType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An information about a cyber security entity, such as a file, system, or network, that has been observed at a particular time</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ObservedDataAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:ObservedDataType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ObservedQuantity" type="nc:QuantityType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A count of the times that each cyber-observable object was seen</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="OrganizationAugmentation" type="cyber:OrganizationAugmentationType" substitutionGroup="nc:OrganizationAugmentationPoint" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>Additional information about an organization</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="OrganizationCategoryCode" type="cyber:OrganizationCategoryCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A kind of organization</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="OriginalAgencyNotifier" type="nc:EntityType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An agency who provided the original notification of a potential incident.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="OriginalPersonNotifier" type="nc:PersonType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A person who provided the original notification of a potential incident.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="Platform" type="cyber:PlatformType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An operating system and hardware on which a software application can be run.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:PlatformType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformCategoryDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of the type of platform impacted such as cloud, bare metal, virtual, or off-premise</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformConduitText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A logical grouping of communication channels, between or connecting two or more zones, that share common security requirements.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformCPSIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if the platform is a cyber-physical system; false otherwise.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformCriticalityRatingText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of the platform's business criticality rating.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformEditionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A Common Platform Environment (CPE) well-formed name text component to capture edition-related terms applied by the vendor to the product.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformImpactRatingText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of the platform's incident impact rating, to include Bulk Energy System (BES) impact ratings.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformLanguageText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A Common Platform Environment (CPE) well-formed name text component to define the language supported in the user interface of the product being described.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformLifeSafetyIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if the platform is responsible for life safety operations; false otherwise.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformLocation" type="nc:LocationType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of the physical location of the platform</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformName" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A name of an operating system and hardware on which a software application can be run</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformOperationStatusIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if the platform is currently in operation; false otherwise.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformOtherText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A Common Platform Environment (CPE) well-formed name text component to capture any other general descriptive or identifying information which is vendor or product-specific and which does not logically fit in any other attribute value.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformOwnerEntity" type="nc:EntityType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An entity who owns the impacted platform.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformOwnerPerson" type="nc:PersonType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A person who owns the platform.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformPartText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A Common Platform Environment (CPE) well-formed name text component to identify a class of applications, a class of operating systems, or a class of hardware devices.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformProductText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A Common Platform Environment (CPE) well-formed name text component to describe or identify the most common and recognizable title or name of the product.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformPurposeText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of the platform's current use in the operating environment.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformSecurityOwnerEntity" type="nc:EntityType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A name of the entity who secures the platform.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformSecurityOwnerPerson" type="nc:PersonType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A person who secures the platform.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformServiceRemovalText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of the ability or limitations of the platform to be removed from service.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformSoftwareEditionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A Common Platform Environment (CPE) well-formed name text component to characterize how the product is tailored to a particular market or class of end users.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformStatus" type="nc:StatusType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A status or state of the platform.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformSubzoneText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A collection of entities within a zone that represents a smaller partitioning of a System under Consideration (SuC) on the basis of their functional, logical, and physical (including location) relationship.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformTargetHardwareName" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A Common Platform Environment (CPE) well-formed name text component to characterize the instruction set architecture (e.g., x86) on which the product being described or identified by the WFN operates.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformTargetSoftwareText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A Common Platform Environment (CPE) well-formed name text component to characterize the software computing environment within which the product operates.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformUpdateText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A Common Platform Environment (CPE) well-formed name text component for a vendor-specific alphanumeric string characterizing the particular update, service pack, or point release of the product.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformValue" type="nc:ItemValueType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A fair market value in whole dollars of other property recovered in addition to the property of record</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformVendorText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A Common Platform Environment (CPE) well-formed name text component for a vendor-specific alphanumeric string characterizing the particular update, service pack, or point release of the product.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformVersionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A Common Platform Environment (CPE) well-formed name text component for a vendor-specific alphanumeric string characterizing the particular release version of the product.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="PlatformZoneText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A collection of entities that represents partitioning of a System under Consideration (SuC) on the basis of their functional, logical, and physical (including location) relationship.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="Protocol" type="cyber:ProtocolType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An established set of rules that determine how data is transmitted between different devices in the same network</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ProtocolAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:ProtocolType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ProtocolCategoryCode" type="cyber:ProtocolCategoryCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A kind of network protocol (transport protocol, network protocol) used for communication</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ProtocolID" type="niem-xs:string" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An identifier of a network protocol used for communication</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ProtocolName" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A name of a network protocol used for communication</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="RansomwareIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if the malware is ransomware; false otherwise.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ReportingOrganizationIdentification" type="nc:IdentificationType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An identification that references a reporting organization</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ResourceDeploymentReasonText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A reason for declaring an emergency incident according to local requirements</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="Responder" type="cyber:ResponderType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An external entity assisting with a cyber incident</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ResponderAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:ResponderType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ResponderOnsiteEndDateTime" type="niem-xs:dateTime" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A date and time at which the external entity ended its response</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ResponderOnsiteQuantity" type="nc:QuantityType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A count of how many personnel responded onsite</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ResponderOnsiteStartDateTime" type="niem-xs:dateTime" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A date and time at which the external entity began its response</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="ResponderOnsiteTimeDuration" type="niem-xs:duration" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A length of how many hours personnel were onsite</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="SecurityEventIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if an incident is a security event that has not been determined to reach the level of an incident but is of sufficient interest to be recorded; false otherwise</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="SecurityIncidentActualityCode" type="cyber:SecurityIncidentActualityCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An indication of actual status of the security incident, based on VERIS codes.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="SignificantIncident" type="cyber:SignificantIncidentType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A designation of whether an incident is classified as a significant incident</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="SignificantIncidentAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:SignificantIncidentType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="SignificantIncidentDesignationReasonText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A reason for declaring the Incident a significant incident according to local requirements.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="SignificantIncidentDesignator" type="nc:PersonType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An entity who made the decision to classify as a significant incident</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="SourcePortID" type="niem-xs:string" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An identifier of the port of a source system that initiates a communication</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="SystemCategoryName" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A name of particular system type such as General Support System, Major Application, Proxy Server</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="TrafficLightProtocolCode" type="cyber:TrafficLightProtocolCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A statement of the permitted redistribution of received information</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="UnattributedCyberIntrusion" type="cyber:UnattributedCyberIntrusionType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of an unattributed cyber intrusion</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="UnattributedCyberIntrusionAnswerIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if the answer to the unattributed cyber intrusion question is Yes; false otherwise</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="UnattributedCyberIntrusionAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:UnattributedCyberIntrusionType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="UnattributedCyberIntrusionQuestionCategoryName" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A name of an unattributed cyber intrusion question category</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="UnattributedCyberIntrusionQuestionSubcategoryName" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A name of an unattributed cyber intrusion question subcategory</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="UnattributedCyberIntrusionQuestionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A textual representation of an unattributed cyber intrusion question</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="UserAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:UserType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="VulnerabilityExploitationAvailabilityCode" type="cyber:VulnerabilityExploitationAvailabilityCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A kind of availability for a cyber exploit.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="VulnerabilityExploitAvailability" type="cyber:VulnerabilityExploitAvailabilityType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A possibility for a vulnerability to be exploited.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="VulnerabilityExploitAvailabilityAugmentationPoint" abstract="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An augmentation point for type cyber:VulnerabilityExploitAvailabilityType</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="VulnerabilityExploitDescriptionText" type="nc:TextType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>A description of a vulnerability.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="VulnerabilityIsKnownIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if vulnerability is known; false otherwise</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="VulnerabilityIsPublicIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if vulnerability is publicly acknowledged; false otherwise</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="VulnerabilityRemoteCodeExecutableIndicator" type="niem-xs:boolean" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>True if vulnerability allows for remote code execution; false otherwise</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
  <xs:element name="VulnerabilityWidespreadCode" type="cyber:VulnerabilityWidespreadCodeType" nillable="true">
    <xs:annotation>
      <xs:documentation>An information about how many entities are impacted by a vulnerability.</xs:documentation>
    </xs:annotation>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>
